title: Functions that Apply to Rows and Columns of `data.frame`
text: Working data.frame objects often involves computing various summaries across rows columns. base R’s apply function can handle operations, comes several limitations: Unintuitive syntax MARGIN parameter (1 rows, 2 columns). Poor computational performance repeated function calls. Memory inefficiency creating multiple hard copies. Requires manual handling mixed column types. dfStats package provides collection functions performing efficient row-wise column-wise computations data.frame objects improved performance compared base R operations. package address issues providing intuitive consistently named functions using C++ implementations core operations minimize hard copies.

code: colMeans3(   x,   na.rm = FALSE,   useNames = FALSE,   silence_warnings = FALSE,   no_check = FALSE )  rowMeans3(   x,   na.rm = FALSE,   useNames = FALSE,   silence_warnings = FALSE,   no_check = FALSE,   append = FALSE )

title: Calculate row (column) sums for R data.frame object — colMeans3
text: x data.frame least one row one column. na.rm Logical. NA values removed calculation? Default FALSE. useNames Logical. resulting vector preserve row (column) names input data.frame? Default FALSE. silence_warnings Logical. warnings suppressed non-numeric columns dropped? Default FALSE. no_check Logical. Skip input validation numeric column filtering? Default FALSE. append Logical. means appended new column row_means instead returning vector? Default FALSE.

title: Calculate row (column) sums for R data.frame object — colMeans3
text: append = FALSE (default), returns numeric vector row (column) means. useNames = TRUE input non-default row (column) names, returned vector preserve names. append = TRUE, returns original data.frame additional row_means column.

title: Calculate row (column) sums for R data.frame object — colMeans3
text: Yinchun Su

title: Calculate row (column) sums for R data.frame object — colMeans3
code: df <- data.frame(   a = 1:5,   b = 6:10,   c = 11:15 )  # Basic usage rowMeans3(df) #> [1]  6  7  8  9 10 colMeans3(df) #> [1]  5.00000 13.33333 21.66667  # Append means as new column rowMeans3(df, append = TRUE) #>   a  b  c row_means #> 1 1  6 11         6 #> 2 2  7 12         7 #> 3 3  8 13         8 #> 4 4  9 14         9 #> 5 5 10 15        10  # Preserve row names rownames(df) <- paste0("row", seq_len(nrow(df))) colnames(df) <- LETTERS[seq_len(ncol(df))] rowMeans3(df, useNames = TRUE) #> row1 row2 row3 row4 row5  #>    6    7    8    9   10  colMeans3(df, useNames = TRUE) #>        A        B        C  #>  5.00000 13.33333 21.66667

title: Calculate row (column) sums for R data.frame object — colSums3
code: # example code df <- data.frame(   a = 1:5,   b = 6:10,   c = 11:15 )  # Basic usage rowSums3(df) #> [1] 18 21 24 27 30 colSums3(df) #> [1] 15 40 65  # Append sums as new column rowSums3(df, append = TRUE) #>   a  b  c row_sums #> 1 1  6 11       18 #> 2 2  7 12       21 #> 3 3  8 13       24 #> 4 4  9 14       27 #> 5 5 10 15       30  # Preserve row names rownames(df) <- paste0("row", seq_len(nrow(df))) colnames(df) <- LETTERS[seq_len(ncol(df))] rowSums3(df, useNames = TRUE) #> row1 row2 row3 row4 row5  #>   18   21   24   27   30  colSums3(df, useNames = TRUE) #>  A  B  C  #> 15 40 65
